content.detailedDescription: duas bolas avermelhadas que cruzavam o c���u fora da rota de vou uma era mais r���pida que a outra enquanto uma era muito veloz a outra passava meio que fazendo um reconhecimento depois permaneceram paradas juntas por um longo per���odo
content.summary: Duas bolas vermelhas e alta velocidade

content.detailedDescription: I was at a park with some friends just hanging out. i noticed something in the sky moving, thought it was geese at first. as i continued to watch i realized the object had a shape to it, and what i thought, for a split second, were geese flying in formation, were actually dim circular lights on the underbelly of a boomerang shaped object . i watched the object fly in a straight line for about 5 seconds, then it completely disappeared. thought i was crazy for a little bit, but i couldn't deny what i saw. i didn't tell my friends at first, because i didn't think they'd take me seriously. decided to report what i saw when i read an article about someone who had seen exactly what i did.
content.summary: At densmore at night, a nearly transparent arrow-shaped object with circular lights flew over then disappeared

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were sitting on our back patio when my wife said their is a big bird ...No wait that is not a bird what is that and that is when i turned around and saw the object and then that is when i said that is not a plane...It has no lights and is not making any noise we watched it as it continued with the same speed. i did not want to take my eyes off it to run for a camera as i was in awe. i thought to my self someone else has to see this, i was so sure that someone else seen it that i watched the news to see if it had been reported but a big disappointment a big no.That is what surprised me most because it seemed to be the size of a bus. my wife and i watched this until we could no longer see it which was between 2 and three minutes.
content.summary: Black upside down pine tree with one large sizebox shape connected to it and one small box

content.detailedDescription:
Observed white glowing sphere fly below clouds direct flight towards northwest. had fuzzy aura looked similar to paint brush marks coming from
one side of the sphere. moved slowly and direct path.

i first thought it was a falling star but much to big and no tail.

i saw a smaller red orb flying a few months ago. the red sphere flew much faster and was much smaller. it also flew in the exact opposite direction of the new white sphere.

lost sight as it went over the hill. i would really love to know what they are. we are going to attempt setting a camera on the roof.
content.summary: Observed white glowing round object flying directly above house

content.detailedDescription: July 4th colorado springs, co -getting out of a truck to go inside home, i see a dozen stars in the night sky over colorado springs. this is odd since there are no other visible stars in the sky due to a thick cloud cover that night. as i stare directly at this silent  group of (12 or more) lights, wondering which constellation it was....The whole group of lights started to slowly drift away in a northern direction until they were out of my sight.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: A dozen stars twinkle in a cloudy night sky over colorado springs, then fly away!!!

content.detailedDescription: 1. wildwood, n.J.  schellinger ave., waterpark  -  sunbathing on a lounge chair, facing the ocean (very end of pier) i was looking at beach & ocean.     2.  there was nothing in the sky at the time, except this spot.  3.  i was looking at the horizon, a bird or kite or airplane at a very high altitude.   4.  it was a dull black in color, it seemed to be stationary, it then rotated or rolled as the sun broke through a cloud and a bright (spark-like) reflection caught my eye, i had to blink and it was gone.  5.  i thought "wow, i saw another one."  i asked my son-in-law if he saw it but, he did not.   6.  after blinking from the flash in my eyes, i lost it, i continued to watch the sky but, no other sightings.
content.summary: the sun came thru hazey clouds, hit it, then a super bright flash(reflection)

content.detailedDescription: Was not witnessed by myself... but by at least 5 people.. a line of 10 lights flying over the organ mountains in las cruces nm on 7-3-13 about 10:30pm (this would be the white sands missle range area behind these mountains) that were observed for about 5 mintues traving south and changing configurations from cicles to v shapes and several others..
content.summary: A group of 10 lights traving south over the organ moutains that change there configurations  into many different shapes like circles and such

content.detailedDescription: We were walking back to camp after fishing at the forks of the kern. we  noticed what appeared to be a american airline plane shining above the rock dome of a mountain. we noticed it didn't move or have wings. we proceeded back to camp to get cameras. it was a few min walk when we returned it was still there. we took pictures after observing for a while it seemed to disappear, later realizing i got a picture of it as it took off at a 45���angle straight up.
content.summary: We observed a shiny thing hovering, took pictures,i only have one left of it ascending.

content.detailedDescription: July 6th, 2013 during the annual local fireworks display i noticed a yellowish glowing object coming in from the west of the fireworks display, which was do north of my position. i had thought is was some firework being shot off from that area although i hadn't seen any other fireworks during the fireworks display. that's most likely the reason it caught my attention in the first place. it seemed to be descending, then it seemed to move parallel to the deck (ground). it appeared to come out from nowhere and it disappeared into thin air, like it did when it appeared. i didn't say anything about it at the time, but upon reviewing the video clips of the fireworks i was surprise to have actually captured it for a brief moment when it disappeared.
content.summary: Unknown object during fireworks 2013

content.detailedDescription: Was very cold that night. was bundled up for 20 degree weather. when blowing 40 miles an hour. low-level visibility 1 mile. upper level visibility 30 mile. had been watching jets dogfight and do maneuvers earlier that night.  11  to 2am maybe.  was around 3 o'clock a.M. i noticed a triangular shaped object floating about a half mile north of my location. big white lights at each corner of the triangle on bottom part. a little while later accelerated turned and disappeared very fast. have more info. not joke
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: 1 big 60ft white lights at each corner, sides 250ft by 40ft angled 50° to top. never moved until rapid left turn and burled out of sight

content.detailedDescription: The exact date and time are estimated because i did not know where to legitimately report this sighting at the time of the incident. in the summer of 2012, in edgewood, ri, on narragansett bay adjacent to stillhouse cove, at night, i, and a friend, were inside his house working on the computer, when we witnessed glowing orange orbs (at least six...) which appeared from the west moving over the water in an easterly direction. at first we thought they were military helicopters shining down lights, because of their size, but when we ran out to the deck there was no sound from their direction, or otherwise. there were just these glowing orange orbs moving in unison, but not in a pattern. the size of the orbs were what you would expect if a large helicopter were moving above the rooftops and shining a light large enough to obscure the shape and presence of the helicopter. their path varied slightly, changing directions, hovering intermittently, then slowly moving across the water toward the opposite side of the bay where they disappeared into some cloud cover on the other side. it spanned just a few minutes. no strange noises, sensations or emotions. we watched with rapt curiosity...No fear...Just focused interest. astonishing moment.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Over narragansett bay observed orange glowing orbs(5-6) that traveled w. to e. in unison...Varied path with intermittent hovering. the grouping crossed the bay then disappeared into cloud cover on the opposite side.

content.detailedDescription:
While watching the 4th of july parade at 10:39am, i saw a flashing light in my peripheral version. when i looked, i saw an object hovering above the nearby mountains (approximately 4 miles away). it appeared approximately 200 meters above the ground. the length of the object to the naked eye was slightly smaller than ������. it had a very distinct shape, sigmoidal or s-shaped and reminded me of a pinwheel. it was spinning clockwise around the center mass, and it was the sun reflecting off of the appendages that had caught my eye. the speed at which the object was spinning would change from very fast (appearing to look circular) to almost a complete stop. as the object spun, it was also moving erratically up, down, side to side, and diagonally, all very quickly. it was able to change directions instantaneously, even going in the exact opposite direction instantly. 
while it was moving through the sky, the object tilted about 90 degrees so that it then appeared like a typical disc or saucer shape. in this position, i could make out that the shape was elliptical. when i zoomed in to take a picture of it at this angle, i could see that the upper body seemed to extend over the bottom portion on the left side and was just the opposite on the right side. i believe the object was not spinning at the time so i was seeing it from the side in a stationary position. in this picture it is possible to see the sun reflecting off of the top dome, so the material was obviously reflective. also, if you zoom in on the second photo you can see what appears to be a concave area on the right side ���wing��� which would indicate the curvature that is seen in the first photo and what gives the object the s-shape.
after about 10-15 seconds, the object dropped behind the mountain and then reappeared a few seconds later, hovered for about 5 seconds, and then dropped in front of the mountain. it was harder to see at this point since it wasn't reflecting as much light and the background color of the mountain was darkish green. i lost sight of it when a parade float stopped in front of me. the entire viewing lasted about 2 minutes. 
unfortunately, i was at the parade by myself, and was surrounded by other people���s children (whom i didn't want to panic); and i was just too stunned to think about pointing it out. i was much more focused on trying to get a couple of good photos. i did try to get some video but the settings were too bright and i was having a hard time finding it through the view-finder, since a bunch of floats where hindering my view.
given the size, shape, and movement of this object, there is no doubt in my mind that this is something solid, metallic, and not man-made. i have never seen an object fly so quickly, change direction so fast, or be able to appear absolutely stationary. the fact that it appeared during the day against a clear, blue sky just made me feel as if this craft was not hiding itself at all. either that or someone turned off the cloaking device and is going to get grounded. ; )
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Started out shaped like a sigmoidal curve. thicker middle, extending in opposite direction into two curved appendages. when it tipped it appeared disc shaped..

content.detailedDescription:
earlier in may, my mother heard about the balloon glow and suggested that we go check it out.  it was our first time, even though it's a yearly event, and we both figured it would be a good place to shake off the dust from our cameras.  on the 17th, we drove out to howard co.  it was fairly cloudy at first, but the weather seemed to cooperate the later it got, and the moon decided to peek out.
     i didn't realize the time until after i took my photographs; mom had the watch on, but it was dark.  overall, without looking at my raw files, it was 9-10pm.  i was working on my last set:  a hot-air balloon floating up into the night sky, trying to work in the moon, when i saw a rotating, flashing light.  it reminded me of one of those light up toys you can buy at the circus where lights flash off and on, spinning quickly in a circle--or like a police light bar--hovering high over an apartment complex.  i had no idea what it was, but for the sake of curiosity i fired a few photographs off.  the balloon sailed down, obscured my vision, and by the time it landed, the lit object in the sky was gone.  honestly i thought i hadn't taken any photographs of it at all.
     in the next few days, i set up adobe photoshop elements and began fixing up a few photographs, adding exposure and reducing noise (adding exposure brightens a photograph, and since it was dark, the higher the iso or sensitivity to light setting on a camera, the more noise--the gritty bits in a photograph--there is).  eventually i got into the images that i took near the end of the night, and when i brightened the one in question, a shape became visible.  it couldn't have been a lens flare; i'd debunked some of my other photographs earlier.  a small, remote-controlled helicopter was flying around the field while the balloons were being taken down, but i hadn't seen it in the time i was taking pictures of this particular balloon.  the object has a definite shape, the classical ufo look.  i brought mom over to check the files and she seemed as stunned as i am.  we didn't want to make any assumptions, but seeing the image for the first time certainly made it hard not to.
content.summary: Appeared during photo shoot of howard co. balloon festival.  disappeared behind photographing balloon.  object unknown; curious/ looking for examiners for photos.

content.detailedDescription: 8:55 pm  taking out garbage when a large grey object caught my eyes, i thought it was a ballon but no wind a dead calm no noise just a steady streight flight path ran back into house grabbed camera. flight was streight north ran to back of house to get more pics
content.summary: Thought it was ballon

content.detailedDescription:
I was on my balcony facing east over lake washington just before 10:00pm, taking a break from hanging pictures around the condo. stepped outside to take a short rest and enjoy some of the clear, night air.

a rapidly ascending light caught my eye over the treetops. it appeared to be in an almost straight ascent at a pretty high speed and i thought it was a laser or something at first. then i noticed that as it passed in front of clouds it didn't refract light at all, but rather just blocked them from view as would an object.

it made several slight, directional changes and speed changes as it ascended. i called my girlfriend to see it and she observed it as well. i described it as a 'very motivated balloon with thrusters'... as it did appear to have an almost 'floating' quality about its flight - but ascended much too rapidly and changed directions to be a balloon (unless there are new, high-performance types that i have not seen).

as it got higher up it dimmed and became obscured behind clouds, and reappeared from time to time as it ascended. i lost sight, but my girlfriend caught a last glimpse of it what would have to be several miles up at this point. then it was gone.

i've never seen anything like it -- and would not have thought of myself as a 'ufo reporting type person' -- but i'm pretty up on modern aviation and this didn't seem to have any flight characteristics i'd seen before -- nor did it seem like a random light or laser.

i scanned the news the next day, but didn't see any other sightings -- though would be interested in hearing from anyone else who might have seen it.

i tried to catch it on my iphone, but couldn't find it on the small view-screen - and so opted to observe instead of fumbling with my camera.

it appeared to be coming from somewhere just east of lake washington -- a bit south of the 520 bridge - but could have been up to a couple miles farther east for all i know.
content.summary: Orb-like object, glowing in a hazy, white light

content.detailedDescription: It was spotted by the end of east 7th street and there were rumbles and heat and random glowing lights.
content.summary: There was a low and then a loud rumble and then there were random lights and it gave off heat.

content.detailedDescription:
Historical sighting - witness (a) was not the eye witness, but witness (a) questioned closely the controller involved, witness (b).  witness (a) was an air traffic controller at miami international at the time this event occurred.   he came on duty at 10:00am on this day, the whole facility was buzzing, so he asked ���what was going on���. the person he asked said that the midnighters had seen a ufo at the airport earlier.  witness (a) did not get the full details for several weeks. the controller, witness (b), was obviously upset over what he had witnessed and refused to talk about it.  witness (a) waited a few weeks for the right time and when it was quiet he asked this controller to tell him the whole story.  
witness (b) said that he was working the midnight shift and his relief had arrived up in the tower cab as well as a flight data assistant (three total, witnesses (b), (c), (d)). they were chatting and one them looked up at the tower radar display.  something was quickly moving across the scope from the north and toward the airport. the observer called out, they all started looking out the windows (it was dark but getting light in the east).  to the north something low was covering up the lights on the ground. at this point the ufo is almost over airport. they all saw it as it came to a hover over the commuter ramp, (low, 100 feet or less) which is in the middle of the airport, without any illumination lighting visible.  at this point i stopped the story to ask a question; how big was it? witness (b) said it was about the size of a b-727, which is quite large.  he also said that it was dark in color, maybe dark olive. 
the object hovered over a vehicle and turned on a bright light.  there was a ramp person in the vehicle asleep, witness (e).  the ramp vehicles all have radios tuned to the ground control frequency.  witness (e) started screaming on frequency for the tower to quit playing pranks.  the light stayed on for several minutes. remember it���s getting lighter outside every minute. the light turned off and it continued to hover. now it���s light enough to see detail.  
the object then rises vertically and passes very close to an arriving eastern airlines a-300.  the aircraft was coming in from the south and was on downwind and preparing to land.  the pilot, witness (f), asked ���what the hell was that?��� the controllers said that they did not know. the object continued up to many thousands of feet, but still visible from the ground.
at this point a controller supervisor, witness (g), was driving into work, saw the object ascend and watched it until it stopped ascending, when the object stopped it stayed motionless for several minutes and then it started to gyrate wildly, turned on white, red, green lights, while still gyrating and had many multi-colored lights flashing.  the object performed like this for several more minutes.  when it stopped it stayed motionless for several minutes and then suddenly went vertically out of sight.  
in the tower things were hectic trying to see if the radar room could see anything and getting the airliner on the ground.  while taxiing in, the pilot, witness (f), asked if the controllers knew anything more, then stated ���well i guess i���ve seen one now���.  over the next hour or so ���answers��� started coming from various agencies, none of which was accepted by the controller witnesses.  in the end the faa told them to say nothing of the event.  one final thing, witness (b) mentioned that for the next couple of hours (no wind) a yellow-green/violet haze was seen to stay in the area where the object had been hovering. this event was a catalyst, of sorts, to open a host of stories from other controllers.  
this case was a secondary sighting provided by witness (a) for michigan case #47976, provided herewith by daniel j snow, mi cfi 16776.  quick background check, witness also had a fl address, sighting also posted to nuforc 27apr04 by same author.
content.summary: Gray/dark olive delta wing object, on radar north, then 3 miles north of mia, hovering 100 ft over commuter terminal, ascends upward past arriving airliner.

content.detailedDescription: It was late january 2013 on a saturday night. i was at my brother's for the weekend and had stayed up late to watch a hitchcock movie with him and my nephew. my brother & i decided to step out and have a cigarette on his front porch. as we stood there sharing a smoke together & were small talking i noticed a "bright star" type light that seemed stationary in the sky. i pointed it out to my brother (who is a 30 + police veteran) and he acknowledged it seemed pretty bright, too. as we hung out together talking, we kept looking at the light and noticed that was very slowly moving across the sky but at a speed so slow that if your didn't really watch it, you would probably wouldn't notice the movement. our interest was peaked and we started wondering what the heck it could be. the object began to strobe different colors & continued to do so throughout the entire event. my brother called for his son to come outside & look at it as well. we noticed it slowly went from left to right across the sky and a slow declined angle toward the distant tree line. my brother told his son to go get his high definition binoculars that he uses for police work. upon his son returning, we began taking turns looking at the lights with the binoculars and could see that there was some type of object with exterior strobing lights in the sky. we got pretty excited & also dumbfounded and kept debating what it could be. at about that time my nephew pointed out a 2nd light in the sky... very very similar, if not exact to the 1st 1 we had been observing. this 2nd object was first observed at a further left end of the sky.. and under a long horizontal cloud that was more misty than thick. the 2nd object hovered in the bottom area of this thin cloud and began moving in the same manner as the 1st object, i.E., slow but strobing. its direction was heading from around the bottom of the cloud cover and more toward the center of the sky. we probably stayed outside observing it for 45 min- 1 hr and when we went back inside to finish the hitchcock movie (about 10 mins of the movie left) the objects (both of them) were still there in the sky strobing and very slowly moving. the 2nd 1 seemed to be moving further away because it got smaller. the 1st 1 seemed just as bright but lower in the sky. when i left to go to his camper to get some rest objects were still there but i went on to bed. my brother related to me later that after i went to bed he and his son stepped out to see if they were still there and they were. the next morning of course it seemed like all we could talk about and the objects were not there anymore. i'll never forget it.
content.summary: Noticed 1 light at 1st in the sky..Thought it was a plane, star, etc but it strobed and hovered and very slowly moved.. then saw a 2nd 1 after that.

content.detailedDescription:
we went to my backyard, approx. 9pm on july 4th to see fireworks. 

immediately we observed a red-orange ball of light in sky moving slow but steady south to north. we watched it silently fly overhead.  the light only  appears at the front of the object and the back is unlit. several more appeared on the same path and going the same speed. during these sightings an airplane appeared higher than the objects and you could hear it. during each appearance a bat would appear flying erratically...Don't know if that matters but did not want to leave anything out.
content.summary: 8-10 red-orange balls of light flying south to north

content.detailedDescription:
the shooting took place in the night of 30th june 2013.Anca waas sleeping at home. even though the ships seem to be red and they were flashing, in reality their light was very bright and stable.
at first these ships were standing. then, they started to move slowly in groups of 3 to 4 or maybe more while the others remained in place. they didn't make any sound.
i saw clearly one of the ship which went above my building (i don't know exactly at what distance was the ship, but it was enough to see clearly the ship's shape). it was ovoid and had a light color.
content.summary: I was sleeping. i noticed lights inside my room. i thought they were stars.

content.detailedDescription:
My grandma, her friends, and i were getting ready to watch some fireworks.It was around 9:15 at night est. many airplanes are known to fly in the area, but something told me that it was more than an airplane. we all were looking at the sky, when i noticed it and said,"hey, an airplane!". then i noticed that it was just blinking and then slowly started to go on a straight path away from the airport location, but it was picking up speed. since i believed it was merely an airplane at first, i just concentrated on the fireworks, and not the object. after the fireworks were over, i looked to see if i could still see it, but it was long gone after a 25 minute firework display. 
after the sighting, i felt a little bit scared and was and psyched myself out about it. now, i am pretty confident it is an ufo, but still not quite sure.
content.summary: Glowed, sequentially blinked, looked similar to airplane.

content.detailedDescription:
Saw the first large orange orb at approx 10pm.  initially couldnt identify as meteor? or what?   watched it cross the horizon at abt airline cruising altitude from northern most horizon to southern most horizon.   as the 4 adults discussed it for 5 minutes, we then noticed a second large orange orb following the exact same trajectory from n to s.  
very obviously not a plane, comet, meteor, helicopter, etc. 
no sound, no trails, moving very distinctly along the same paths.
content.summary: 2 large orange orbs trailing across the horizon n to s

content.detailedDescription: I live in longview, washington. on july 4th i saw what appeared to be a ufo. this could not have been a chinese sky lantern or a firework. i got video of it but it's not the best and certainly couldn't be used to support my claim. i would rather just tell you what i saw and maybe there's radar evidence of it or something. at 10:30 i arrived back with my mom to our house from our local firework show. we got out of the car and that's when my mom noticed something in the sky. at first we thought it was a plane burning and about to crash somewhere around our house. we kept watching this huge ball of flame keep moving and pass over our house and into the next horizon. this thing had to have been at jet-liner altitude and was about 2 or 3 jets wide and about 2 long, i mean it was huge especially when we saw it pass over us. went from horizon to horizon in about 2 or 3 minutes and was in a direct line. it was seen in the portland area and passed off as chinese lanterns but i saw it in longview and i can certainly say it was not one. it headed in a line which came from the beach and was traveling west to east. i just want to know if it was a satellite or a plane or if maybe i saw was something truly special. thanks a bunch- kyle shay
content.summary: A huge fireball flying overhead

content.detailedDescription: This morning at 6am, i was sleeping and woke up to a very loud noise. i sat up in bed. my dogs (3 of them) barked a few short barks.  the noise was sort of like music, maybe 3 or 4 notes played over and over. same sound. almost like the movie close encounters, but the music was different. it sounded mechanical, like a giant machine. my two dogs stopped barking and my 3rd started to howl. he never howls.  i live in a rural area and no neighbors close by.  i went onto the deck without the dogs, i didn't want them to run after something.  as soon as i opened the door my dog stopped howling.  i stood on my deck and looked up, it was a cloudy morning and i couldn't see anything but i could hear it really loud.  i said out loud 'what the hell is that?' i couldn't see anything.  now, i do believe in ufo's and always joke of the mother-ship coming to get me, but for a brief instant i did think this was it.  that is how odd it was.  i went back in my house and locked the door behind me and got back in bed.  the sound eventually got fainter and was gone.  it was coming from above and it was not a sound i could replicate or describe.  the best i can say is it was machine like.  there are no trees above me, there isn't anything.  i am up in elevation. no airports.  viability in the sky was low due to clouds.  after the sound left, about a half hour later, i went outside with one of my dogs, the dog that was howling.  he is able to track planes in the sky that fly at about 30,000 feet, so he has some sense of things beyond most dogs.  there was a strange mist or fog around.  not usual and i thought it was weird.  i looked back at my dog who was starring into the sky.  and looking around like i was.  i know whatever it was, he felt it too.  i am not crazy (well, not more than most) and i have no explanations.  i did call my closest neighbor and he said normally he is up at that time, but for some reason he could not get up this morning.  he did not hear it.  my pets behaved strange for a few hours after.  i have no explanation at all.  i wish i would have thought to record it with my cell.
content.summary: This was a very loud 'music' maybe 4 notes, repeated & faded up.

content.detailedDescription: It was large surface was blue and had random lights coming from all over.
content.summary: Large blue circle-ish

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking my dog in my neighbourhood and talking on my iphone via earbuds to my cousin. at some point i noticed what i, at first, thought to be a very bright star or planet in the sky above me, but then it moved rather quickly like the speed of a satellite, but not in a "satellite path" and plus it was way too big and bright and not high enough in the atmosphere (i star-gaze on occasion and know exactly what a satellite looks like and moves like.) then it did some "bobbing motions." i was telling my cousin everything that was happening and because of all the trees and houses in the neighbourhood i lost sight of it and thought, "oh well." (i have never been "into ufos") then i turned the corner and saw it again, now appearing stationary and higher in the sky than first observed, so i told my cousin i was hanging up on him to make a video of it. so i did. i was facing south and filming it over a house. i am very bad at estimating distances and speeds so i won't even try. 
2 people taking a walk behind me were also looking up at it and talking amongst themselves and they also saw me start to film and they kept looking back/up at the sky for a bit, but then ultimately just kept on their walk.
to my eye this thing looked bright blue... like led light type of blue and it had this tiny little spot to it that was pinkish-red, but not blinking and not a light. on the iphone video it showed up bright-white like a star (at the beginning). as i was filming at the beginning it looked stationary for about 20 seconds or so, but when i watched the video back i saw it actually moved subtly at times. a low-flying plane came by going west to east or more nw to se. then the orb starting moving slightly west and stopped again. a few seconds later it began descending straight down, going out of my view blocked by the house and then i moved west to see if i could see it still around the house and it went shooting by, very fast (west)and a glimpse of it could be seen through the trees, this time showing up blue on the video.) i raced around the corner to the street behind the house i was filming at was to see if i could get a shot of it going west. there was only a tiny window through the trees, but i saw it moving off into the distance (basically sw)and also descending further. and then i lost sight of it because of the trees and houses and didn't try and search further because it was going too far and too fast, i knew it would be a fruitless effort on foot. on the second video it actually showed up as an ultra-violet purple sometimes and white sometimes, but to my eye it always appeared bright blue. 
i went home and posted the video on twitter/youtube and also did a twitter search to see if anyone else had reported seeing anything that night, but found nothing local... but many from pennsylvania describing the almost exact same thing, which had me wondering if it had just come from there. it did move very fast after all. 
my reactions/feelings? i just thought it was really amazing during and after. no fear or anything. i was really excited to get it on film and since then it's obviously made me start thinking about what's possibly up in the sky, now that i have definitely seen something that is neither plane, satellite, planet or star.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Bright blue orb larger than a star, hovering and flying (slow and fast)

content.detailedDescription: Sitting eatting dinner looking out my kitchen window over the san francisco bay sevral airports suround the bay s.F., oakland , san jose, and haward. iwatch planes take off and land everyday. the bright light coming over the horison from half moon bay mountains. the light hovered thier for 30 minutes . then reduced in size and started floating to the left very slowly then disapeared. when i first saw it i thought it was a plane comming from hawwii. the next day i seen another one but it floated closer to where i was and i was able to show my son and it was huge i sent the footage and i have a lot more doing some crazy things. the objets seem to disapear into thin air after a while.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Seen lots of times, finally got a camera so my family dont think i am going crazy. right out my kitchen window.

content.detailedDescription: While in my backyard myself and my son were looking for satellites. he spotted the object first coming up from the southern sky. object was as bright as an airplane but had no exterior lights (green and red found on the wing tips). at first i thought it could be an airplane but did not see the lights. object was very orange in color and was fuzzy on all of the edges as it passed over. no sound was emitted as planes do when they are flying over even at high altitudes. when the object was directly overhead it emitted four beams of light in the direction it was traveling. we both could distinctly see the four beams turn on and then turn off after being on for about five seconds. these beams had a distinct end as they became very concentrated at the four end points. much like a flash light pointed at a wall. the longer i observed this object the more uneasy i became as it was definitely not anything that i had ever experienced. we lost sight of the object as it passed north over the horizon.
content.summary: Orange circle - four beams of light

content.detailedDescription: While having holiday at carolina beach nc, my husband and i were sitting on our boat at 10:30 pm i noticed a bright red light in the sky, which at first i thought was a beacon light for airplances.  but this red light was not blinking like the beacon lights do.  this looked more like a red star, where there had been no stars before in the night sky.  the red light was not blinking and was not moving in any way.  it was stationary.  i took out our binoculars looked at the light thru them and all i could see was what appeared to be a star like object, hovering in place and glowing bright red.  there were no other stars around this red object nor were there any thing else that was flying by this object.  no airplanes or helicopters were flying at the time.  it was a very calm night on the water and other stars were visible. my husband and i took turns watching this red light through the binoculars for about 30 minutes.  then the light slowly reduced size and disappeared.  i continued to watch that area of the night sky for it to return but it never came back.  my hsband and i couldn't tell you what it is.  it had no blinking lights on it, nor did it move in any way.  it was just like a red light in the sky.  i wanted to make this report so that if someone else sees the same thing, they will know that others have also seen it.
content.summary: Bright red light

content.detailedDescription:
A group of us were overnight star gazing at peoh point (cle elum washington) on friday july 5th 2013. about an hour after sunset looking west when stars became visible a few anomalies occurred throughout the night. most noticeably was 4 lights blinking/flashing from southwest to northwest with reasonable distance in between. after about 3-4 times blinking in sequence (1 2 3 4) three of the four objects began moving. 2 in the same direction heading north and 1 heading straight up going south east. the 2 objects which were a reasonable distance apart actually ended up catching up to each other with one object moving slower, then stationary, until they were close by and proceeded northward at the same speed till out of site. i would have thought the objects were planes or satellites but the sequenced blinking lights followed by the movement and partnered objects was nothing typical of usual satellites or planes/choppers. it almost appeared as if the objects were communicating or signalling. we felt very eerie at that point as it seemed too choreographed for any satellite or plane we have ever seen. this occurred 2 times throughout the whole night.

also throughout the night on multiple occasions (maybe 4-7 times) a single flash (shooting star like) was seen followed by a faint moving object of variable speeds typically moving across the horizon. a couple were witnessed directly overhead. followed by 2 objects moving from the flash as an origin point (maybe a meteor breaking apart and splitting?)they were quick sightings as we would turn to look when our peripherals noticed a flash then we would look and see 1-2 objects moving from that point. it may have just been coincidence of a shooting star followed by satellites. only once did i witness (i was the only one to witness this) a flash (1 second) followed by a slow moving object and as it passed behind the tree in front of me disappeared when i went to look for it on the other side. i kept telling myself they were shooting stars but traveled far too slow to be so. satellites were a possibility but the flash of light was strange.

 i am not sure if you folks have debunked these kinds before but we regularly saw an object moving south to north on the horizon glowing/flashing a light (not plane like)but would flash for 2-3 seconds (it was as bright as a planet)....Fade out but still watch faint object move on path for 10-20 seconds then flash again. it would follow path for 60% of my view then fade away unseen. i assumed it was a satellite or plane flashing light through its path but the brightness and appearance seemed unusual. 

there were 5 of us out there that night and we all witnessed and confirmed that we saw the same thing and that it wasn't peripheral vision playing tricks or tree swaying that caused lower stars to appear like they were flashing/blinking. it was easy to confirm what were planes and what were satellites. what i mentioned above was what we witnessed that we could not figure out what it could possibly be. hopefully you have encountered these before and have debunked them. otherwise i am happy to have finally observed my first ufo. thank you
content.summary: 4 lights flashing in sequence 3-4 times then witnessed 3 objects move in straight line possible curved path
